Description: A large GPS dataset of mobility behaviour in Switzerland, with 21,571 initial survey respondents and 3,680 completing 8 weeks of GPS tracking, many extending beyond a year.
Title: MOBIS

Description: GPS trajectory dataset collected by 182 users over more than four years (2007-2012), containing 17,621 trajectories covering 1.2 million km.
Title: Geolife

Description: Smartphone sensor data for activity recognition, collected from 60 participants over approximately 7 days each.
Title: The ExtraSensory Dataset

Description: Physical and virtual sensor data collected from real-world smartphone usage ("in-the-wild"), freely annotated by users to describe complex daily activities (e.g., work, restaurant, sports). Includes motion sensors, active apps, device proximity, and weather conditions; GPS is implied through localization.
Title: ContextLabeler Dataset

Description: Sensor data (accelerometer, magnetometer, gyroscope, environment, GPS, and microphone) collected during immobile activities (driving, watching TV, sleeping), with the smartphone placed in various positions and environments.
Title: Daily Motionless Activities Dataset

Description: Raw sensor data (accelerometer, gyroscope, magnetometer, GPS localization, and environment) for immobile activities, similar to the previous dataset but focused on unprocessed raw data.
Title: Raw Dataset for Activities Without Motion

Description: Dataset for human activity recognition in real conditions, orientation-independent, placement-independent, and subject-independent; includes accelerometer, gyroscope, magnetometer, and GPS for four activities (inactive, active, walking, driving).
Title: Real-life Human Activity Recognition Dataset

Description: Labeled behavioral data from 4 individual goats and 2 sheep performing 9 different activities. Sensors include accelerometer, gyroscope, magnetometer, temperature, and pressure, placed around the animals' necks with non-fixed orientation, sampled at 200 Hz. Collected for 1 day per animal, focused on activity recognition (e.g., movements, behaviors). No explicit GPS, but motion data for behavioral trajectory analysis.
Title: Labeled Behavioral Data from 4 Individual Goats and 2 Sheep Dataset

Description: Sample of one-week GPS trajectories from taxis, for urban transportation analysis.
Title: T-Drive Dataset

Description: A large-scale 3D, open dataset designed for autonomous driving, robotics, and 4D perception tasks. It provides rich real-world data captured via ADAS cameras and LiDAR sensors, including LiDAR point clouds, monocular depth estimates, object detection, and semantic segmentation. While GPS traces are not explicitly mentioned, driving data implies localizations for varied environments (highway, urban, rural; day, night, rainy).
Title: Rovr Dataset

Description: Anonymized GPS trajectories for mobility analysis (163 instances, with trajectory and point tables).
Title: GPS Trajectories (UCI)

Description: GPS trajectories of tourists, potentially from the Swedish ISA project (vehicle tracking in Swedish cities).
Title: GPS Trajectories Tourist (projet suédois)

Description: The first comprehensive GPS trajectory dataset in Southeast Asia, collected via Grab drivers' phones, with contextual info (accuracy, heading, speed) for urban applications.
Title: Grab-Posisi Dataset

Description: Continuous data on individual behavior and social networks via mobile phones, including GPS for mobility.
Title: Mobile Data Challenge (MDC) Dataset

Description: GPS trajectories from one person for traffic rule classification at intersections (covering much of the city).
Title: Single User Trajectory Collection for the Region of Hannover

Description: Anonymized human mobility trajectories, discretized into 30-minute intervals and 500m grid cells, with additional POI data.
Title: YJMob100K

Description: The dataset consists of two large-scale human mobility collections in major cities (Paris and New York City), built from public GPS trajectories retrieved from OpenStreetMap. Each trajectory is enriched with contextual layers (stops, trips, points of interest, inferred transport modes, weather data) and synthetic social media posts generated by a large language model (Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct). Data is provided in tabular (Pandas dataframes) and RDF (knowledge graph) formats to support semantic reasoning and FAIR principles. Anonymization: User IDs replaced with random unique numbers.
Title: Semantically Enriched Mobility Dataset with Contextual and Social Dimensions

Description: Human mobility traces collected at five sites (university campuses, city, amusement park, fair), including GPS for mobility modeling.
Title: CRAWDAD NCSU/MobilityModels

Description: Fine-grained mobility data collected via the Android LifeMap app on commercial smartphones, for human mobility studies, location prediction, and energy optimization in monitoring systems. Includes GPS traces (latitude/longitude with accuracy/error bound), Wi-Fi fingerprints (MAC addresses and signal strength of surrounding APs), GSM footprints, user-defined place types (e.g., workplace, cafeteria), and high-sampling-rate movement data (room-level accuracy indoor/outdoor). Data is anonymized and used to model daily life patterns.
Title: Lifemap

Description: Anonymized call detail records (CDR) including calls and SMS, with individual trajectories based on antenna positions and sub-prefectures (no pure GPS, but cellular localization for mobility). Four sets: antenna-to-antenna traffic, trajectories for 50k/500k customers, and communication graphs.
Title: Orange “Data for Development” (D4D) Challenge Dataset on Mobile Phone Data in Ivory Coast

Description: Large-scale smartphone sensor dataset (all sensors, including GPS) for multimodal locomotion and transportation analysis. Precise annotations for 28 contexts (transport modes, posture, indoor/outdoor location, road conditions, etc.). Collected with 4 smartphones worn at different body positions and a camera.
Title: The University of Sussex-Huawei Locomotion and Transportation Dataset (SHL Dataset)

Description: Multi-sensor dataset for human mobility analysis, including high-frequency GPS traces (156 million records), WiFi fingerprints (25.7 million), GSM/cellular (8 million), accelerometer (90 million), and battery (7 million). Focused on visited points of interest, GSM antennas, WiFi hotspots, and unique mobility patterns, with strict privacy measures (anonymization and NDA required).
Title: Prima'mov Dataset

Description: User activity data collected via a WeChat mini-program, including check-ins at points of interest (POI), weather queries, and nearby user/POI discovery. Data includes timestamps, user locations (latitude/longitude), operation types (e.g., check-in, weather check, login), and device info (e.g., OS, phone brand), recorded in event logs. Supports spatial-temporal behavior studies for human mobility and urban computing.
Title: LBSLab Dataset

Description: Dataset combining high-frequency GNSS traces, verified trip records, and detailed individual-level information for over 3,300 participants. Includes an individual database (sociodemographic, education, household), a trip database (over 80,000 annotated trips with transport modes, durations, purposes), and raw GPS traces (~500 million points recorded every 2-3 seconds via Bluetooth GPS trackers). Supplemented by travel logs and interviews for validation; anonymized for GDPR (blurring of trip starts/ends via H3 grid).
Title: NetMob25 Dataset : A High-resolution Multi-layered View of Individual Mobility in Greater Paris Region
